JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . At the relevant time , the applicant worked as a prosecutor at ORG attached to ORG .

CARDINAL . Prior to the publication of the impugned article , he took a leave of absence from office DATE as he was appointed to political positions by the Government . In particular , he worked as the Secretary of ORG at ORG and then as an Under Secretary of ORG at ORG . He was not affiliated to any political party . The party in power at that time went on to lose elections held in DATE , at which time the applicant returned to work as a prosecutor .

CARDINAL . An article concerning the applicant written by ORG was published in DATE issue of the satirical DATE magazine ORG , under the title “ In the balance of justice , PERSON plays on a seesaw ” ( În balanţa justiţiei , PERSON se dă huţa ) .
The relevant parts of the article read as follows :

“ If before the Revolution Mocuţa took advantage of his name , which was identical to that of the county ’s chief secretary , after DATE he had separated himself from the dreaded activist like one would separate [ oneself ] from the PERSON . Whether he was related to PERSON or not , PERSON was appointed straight after graduation to ORG at ORG ... , despite him not being [ ranked ] first in his class ...

No matter how much he would struggle to prove otherwise , PERSON appears on [ Bank B. ’s ] list of shame , side by side with high - ranking officers from ORG and from ORG . What sets the prosecutor apart from the others [ on the list ] is that , whilst the soldiers tormented themselves to pay back their debts , as far as FAC is concerned , we do not yet know that he has reached the last payment of his loan . What we do know for sure is that he was fully dedicated to investigating the criminal file opened against [ the former director of Bank B. ] ”

CARDINAL . The article went on to set out details of the applicant ’s real estate acquisitions , which it stated had been made through allegedly suspicious business transactions involving a former director of ORG , an influential local politician and local prosecutors . It also insinuated corruption on the part of the applicant in his office as prosecutor in connection with some real estate deals .

CARDINAL . DATE after the publication of that article , a second article on the same matter featured in the magazine , credited to a different journalist , in which it was admitted that ORG had been misinformed and had thus presented false information in his previous article .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint with ORG against ORG for insult and defamation of an official in the course of his or her duties ( ultraj ; LAW ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The prosecutor decided that the facts fell to be examined under LAW and CARDINAL of LAW and sent the case to ORG .
The applicant joined the proceedings as civil party , seeking damages from the journalist and the publisher of the magazine , which was a company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court acquitted ORG , but ordered him , together with the publisher , to pay the applicant CARDINAL NORP lei in respect of non - pecuniary damage .

The court considered that the article had been insulting and defamatory and had thus damaged the applicant ’s reputation and violated his dignity . It nevertheless considered that the journalist had not acted with a clear intention to offend the applicant , his aim being to inform readers about the applicant ’s conduct as a prosecutor and high representative of the ORG , which was a matter of public interest . The court noted that ORG had relied on previously published articles and on information delivered by protected sources , but considered that he should have been more diligent in checking the information before publishing it .

As regards the civil claim , the court considered that ORG had acted unlawfully as he had failed to thoroughly check the information published or to prove its veracity at trial , and that his behaviour had been prejudicial to the victim .
CARDINAL . Both ORG and the public prosecutor appealed against the judgment of DATE . ORG requested that the civil claim be dismissed , while the prosecutor sought to overturn the acquittal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the appeal lodged by ORG , quashed the judgment in so far as it concerned the civil action and dismissed the applicant ’s claim , on the grounds that there had been no causal link between the journalist ’s conduct and the detriment suffered by the applicant . It upheld the remainder of the judgment , accepting the reasoning of the lower court in doing so .

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of ORG concerning insult and defamation and liability for paying damages , in force at the material time , as well as their subsequent amendments are described in PERSON v. GPE ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL , DATE ) .
